DOC.brief_summary: This study aim examine role weight gain adipose tissue immune cell influx development obesity relate cardiometabolic disorder . Adipose tissue-mediated chronic systemic inflammation implicate development cardiometabolic disorder obesity . Therefore , resolution adipose tissue inflammation may key ameliorate obesity-associated dyslipidemia , insulin-resistance , cardiovascular disease . Proinflammatory cytokine contribute initial influx immune cell adipose tissue weight gain . However , mechanism regulate cytokine adipose tissue milieu effect weight gain adipose tissue completely understood . The study propose investigate molecular event contribute increase infiltration macrophages T-cells adipose tissue weight gain . The central hypothesis lean subject ( low body fat mass ) , healthy fat gain associate decreased expression proinflammatory cytokine . However , obesity ( high body fat mass ) , adipose tissue alter , permit increase expression inflammatory cytokine fat gain result influx immune cell . To test hypothesis , adipose tissue well characterize lean ( control , low body fat ) obese individual ( high body fat ) baseline modest 5 % weight gain use . Adipose tissue sample subsequent weight loss also examine . For study , obesity define body composition rather body mass index ( BMI ) , several study show BMI adequately define obesity several individual normal BMI may indeed high body fat mass . Individuals body fat content ≤25 % men , & < 35 % woman ) consider lean individual body fat content > 25 % men , ≥35 % woman consider obese .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Age : 18 40 ( inclusive ) year BMI 18.5 < 30 kg/m2 Gender : Both male females allow participate study Predominantly sedentary Absence chronic medical condition seasonal environmental allergy On prescription medication second generation antihistamine ( cetirizine , Fexofenadine , Desloratadine , Loratadine , etc ) , oral contraceptive pill , intrauterine device Not current smoker tobacco user Not pregnant breast feed intend become pregnant breast feed Lean ( low body fat mass ) ( body fat content ≤ 25 % men , < 35 % woman ) n=7 ; Obese ( high body fat mass ) ( body fat content > 25 % men , ≥ 35 % woman ) n=7 Ability provide write informed consent Exclusion Criteria Vulnerable study population exclude Presence chronic disease diabetes , cardiovascular disease Pregnancy Anemic ( hemoglobin < 13.5 g/dL men < 12.0 g/dL woman ) Postmenopausal Smoking Use chronic Medications ( aspirin , statin , antiinflammatory drug ) Subjects find significant sleep disorder exclude Dietary restriction include lactose intolerance , vegan diet Eating disorder may interfere weight gain weight loss
